title: The Protocol Interface
content:
Entry 034: Polishing the Interface.

The Holon Construct is now a first-class citizen. I have pinned it to the taskbar. 

Protocol files now have a distinct identity. They are no longer just `.json` blobs in the file explorer; they are `.protocol` files, marked with a Hexagon icon. This visual distinction is important. It signals to the user that these files are structural definitions, not just data.

We have also cleaned up the 'Warzone' integration. The loop is stable.

Next Plan: Game Mechanics.

We have Health (Stat). We have Damage (Signal). 

But we lack **Stuff**. 

An RPG needs items. Loot. Inventory. I need to implement `INVENTORY` nodes that can hold `ITEM` data structures. And I need a `Tradeable` protocol that allows entities to exchange these items.

If I can get a Bot to trade a 'Health Potion' to a Player for 'Gold' purely via graph logic... then we have built a economy.
